@graph.name: Gluten-free Zucchini Basil Focaccia. Vegan GF gumfree - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Zucchini Basil focaccia. Gluten free gum free focaccia. Soft and fluffy focaccia bread recipe. Free of gluten, soy, dairy, egg, corn, nut.

itemListElement.name: Gluten-free Zucchini Basil Focaccia. Vegan GF gumfree

@graph.name: Gluten-free Zucchini Basil Focaccia. Vegan GF gumfree
@graph.description: Gluten-free Zucchini Basil Focaccia. Vegan GF gumfree
recipeIngredient: 7 Tablespoons gf Oats (ground fine( a bit less than 1/2 cup))
2 Tablespoons non dairy Yogurt (I used SoDelicious plain coconut milk yogurt)
1 teaspoon active dry yeast (I used red star)
1/2 teaspoon minced garlic (roasted or raw, I added roasted)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl. add warm water, yeast and sugar, Mix well and let sit until frothy(10 minutes)
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl. add warm water, yeast and sugar, Mix well and let sit until frothy(10 minutes)

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients well.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the dry ingredients, yogurt and oil into the yeast mixture and mix for 2 minutes until a slightly stiff battery dough is formed. See picture.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the dry ingredients, yogurt and oil into the yeast mixture and mix for 2 minutes until a slightly stiff battery dough is formed. See picture.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the bowl and let sit in a warm place for 1.5 hours or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover the bowl and let sit in a warm place for 1.5 hours or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the batter with a spoon and if too wet, add a teaspoon or so Oats flour. The mixture after the first rise, will be like a sticky dough.(The dough should not be a flowy cake batter or a stiff bread dough. Anything in between and it should bake fine.)
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the batter with a spoon and if too wet, add a teaspoon or so Oats flour. The mixture after the first rise, will be like a sticky dough.(The dough should not be a flowy cake batter or a stiff bread dough. Anything in between and it should bake fine.)

recipeInstructions.text: Drop this dough into a parchment lined pan. Oil your hands and pat it down to the required thickness.
recipeInstructions.name: Drop this dough into a parchment lined pan. Oil your hands and pat it down to the required thickness.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and let rise for 35-40 minutes in a warm place.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and let rise for 35-40 minutes in a warm place.

recipeInstructions.text: Make some dimples on the dough lightly(you can skip the dimples since the dough is sticky andwill collapse completely under too much pressure. just make a few dents with an oiled finger if possible)
recipeInstructions.name: Make some dimples on the dough lightly(you can skip the dimples since the dough is sticky andwill collapse completely under too much pressure. just make a few dents with an oiled finger if possible)

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle EVOO on the dimples or just generally on the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Drizzle EVOO on the dimples or just generally on the top.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle dried herbs of choice, black pepper and salt. Place some zucchini slices(optional)
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle dried herbs of choice, black pepper and salt. Place some zucchini slices(optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Spray water on top. Cover the pan with aluminium foil. Make 1 or 2 holes in the foil, to let excess steam escape.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray water on top. Cover the pan with aluminium foil. Make 1 or 2 holes in the foil, to let excess steam escape.

recipeInstructions.text: (If using bread pan like me, double it up to reduce browning of the crust). Or use ceramic/stoneware for less browning.
recipeInstructions.name: (If using bread pan like me, double it up to reduce browning of the crust). Or use ceramic/stoneware for less browning.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 390 degrees F  / 200ºc for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 390 degrees F  / 200ºc for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove foil, remove doubled pan if using and rotate the bread.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove foil, remove doubled pan if using and rotate the bread.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for another 12-15 minutes until required crust color is achieved.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for another 12-15 minutes until required crust color is achieved.

recipeInstructions.text: Take bread out carefully and let cool for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Take bread out carefully and let cool for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Best served warm. Re warm in the oven or in toaster.
recipeInstructions.name: Best served warm. Re warm in the oven or in toaster.
